content.description: Nice block climbing up crimps and edges with a decent landing. Start on the lowest possible holds and climb the face, the detached block below is off. Use heel hooks, tension, or campus up the crimps to a decent top out. Good quality line on nice grippy unpolished stone (rare for the yuba).
content.location: Hoytts Crossing Boulders - Resolution V6 - Just as you get to the signs where the main trail opens to a more rocky outcrop, turn right off the main trail. The boulder lies just above the river off the main trail.

content.description: Using the arete and face holds, climb the block straight up. The detached block is off. Nice line on unpolished grippy stone.
content.location: Hoytts Crossing Boulders - just as you get to the signs where the main trail opens up to a more rocky outcrop, turn right off the main trail. The boulder lies just above the river just off the main trail.

content.description:
Reach up to the horizontal crack and pull up. Mantle on the area around crack and proceed straight up.

Slide of the back of the boulder or scramble back and jump on to the crash pads.

Warning, the beginning of the route is underwater during certain times of the year.
content.location: Off the trail turn right and head towards the water itÂ´s the large boulder downstream from the beach next to the river. Middle of the boulder on the downstream side, about 2 feet to the right of where the left diagonal and right horizontal crack meet.
